info.title: Rapidata Leaderboard API
info.description: The API for the Rapidata Leaderboard service

get.summary: Returns the pairwise vote matrix for a benchmark.
get.description: The matrix is returned in pandas split format.

parameters.name: benchmarkId
parameters.description: The identifier of the benchmark.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Optional tags to filter the matrix entries.

parameters.name: participantIds
parameters.description: Optional participant identifiers to include in the matrix.

parameters.name: leaderboardIds
parameters.description: Optional leaderboard identifiers to scope the matrix.

parameters.name: useWeightedScoring
parameters.description: Whether to apply weighted scoring to the matrix values.

get.summary: Returns the pairwise vote matrix for a leaderboard.
get.description: The matrix is returned in pandas split format.

parameters.name: leaderboardId
parameters.description: The identifier of the leaderboard.

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Optional tags to filter the matrix entries.

parameters.name: useWeightedScoring
parameters.description: Whether to apply weighted scoring to the matrix values.

get.summary: Queries all benchmarks of the user.
Queries all leaderboards for the current user's benchmarks.

parameters.name: benchmarkId
parameters.description: The Id of the benchmark whoms leaderboards will be returned

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Query parameters

get.summary: Returns a single benchmark by its ID.

patch.summary: Updates a benchmark using patch semantics.

get.summary: Query all participants within a benchmark

post.summary: Creates a participant in a benchmark.

get.summary: Queries all the standings for a benchmark by its ID.

parameters.name: benchmarkId
parameters.description: The id of the benchmark, which standings should be queried

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags the benchmark should filter for.

parameters.name: participantIds
parameters.description: The ids of the participants that should be filtered for. leave empty to not filter

parameters.name: leaderboardIds
parameters.description: The ids of the leaderboards that should be filtered for. leave empty to not filter

parameters.name: useWeightedScoring
parameters.description: Whether to use weighted scoring based on user scores (defaults to false for backwards compatibility)

parameters.name: includeConfidenceIntervals
parameters.description: Whether to include the confidence intervals

delete.summary: Deletes a participant on a benchmark.

put.summary: Updates the name of a benchmark.

post.summary: Creates a copy of a public benchmark and all of its related entities

get.summary: Returns the paged prompts of a benchmark by its ID.
Returns the paged prompts of a benchmark by its ID.

parameters.name: benchmarkId
parameters.description: The id of the benchmark to query

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The identifier to filter all samples for

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: additional query settings

post.summary: Adds a new prompt to a benchmark.

parameters.name: benchmarkId
parameters.description: The benchmark id.

get.summary: Query all tags within a benchmark

parameters.name: benchmarkId
parameters.description: The id of the benchmark the prompts should be retrieved from

post.summary: Submits a participant to a benchmark.

get.summary: Queries all leaderboards for a specific benchmark.

parameters.name: request
parameters.description: Query parameters

get.summary: Gets a leaderboard by its ID.

patch.summary: Updates the response config of a leaderboard.

delete.summary: Deletes a leaderboard by its ID.

parameters.name: leaderboardId
parameters.description: The id of the leaderboard that gets deleted

put.summary: Updates the name of a leaderboard.
Updates the response config of a leaderboard.

post.summary: Creates a new leaderboard with the specified name and criteria.

get.summary: returns the paged prompts of a leaderboard by its ID.

post.summary: adds a new prompt to a leaderboard.

parameters.name: leaderboardId
parameters.description: The leaderboard id.

get.summary: queries all the participants connected to leaderboard by its ID.

post.summary: Creates a participant in a leaderboard.

get.summary: queries all the participants connected to leaderboard by its ID.

parameters.name: leaderboardId
parameters.description: The id of the leaderboard, which standings should be queried

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: The tags the leaderboard should filter for.

parameters.name: useWeightedScoring
parameters.description: Whether to use weighted scoring based on user scores (defaults to false for backwards compatibility)

parameters.name: includeConfidenceIntervals
parameters.description: Whether to include the confidence intervals

get.summary: Gets the runs related to a leaderboard
Gets a participant by its ID.
Gets a standing by leaderboardId and participantId.

post.summary: Submits a participant to a leaderboard.
Boosts a subset of participants within a leaderboard.

parameters.name: leaderboardId
parameters.description: the leaderboard that should be boosted

post.summary: Adds a sample to a participant.

parameters.name: participantId
parameters.description: The id of the participant to add the sample to

requestBody.description: The model for the sample creation

post.summary: Adds a sample to a participant.

parameters.name: participantId
parameters.description: The id of the participant to add the sample to

requestBody.description: The model for the sample creation

delete.summary: Deletes a participant on a benchmark.

get.summary: Gets a participant by it's Id.

patch.summary: Updates a participant using patch semantics.

post.summary: Submits a participant to a benchmark.

put.summary: Updates the name of a participant

parameters.name: sampleId
parameters.description: the id of the sample to be deleted.

get.summary: Queries all samples of a participant.

post.summary: This endpoint disables a participant in a benchmark. this means that the participant will no longer actively be matched up against other participants and not collect further results. It will still be visible in the leaderboard.

parameters.name: participantId
parameters.description: The id of the participant to be disabled

put.summary: Updates the tags associated with a prompt.

get.summary: Gets a sample by its Id.

parameters.name: sampleId
parameters.description: The Id of the sample to be retrieved

participants.description: The participants of the given leaderboard that should be boosted.

totalResponses.description: The amount of responses in total that should be added, shared across all participants.

BoostLeaderboardModel.description: The model for boosting a leaderboard.

CreateBenchmarkModel.description: The model for creating a benchmark.

CreateBenchmarkParticipantModel.description: The model to create a participant in a leaderboard

benchmarkId.description: If a leaderboard should be added to a preexisting benchmark, the benchmark Id can be provided.

benchmarkName.description:
If no BenchmarkId is provided a new benchmark will be created. if no name is supplied the benchmark
 will be called the same as the leaderboard.

instruction.description: The instruction datapoints will be matched up against.

showPrompt.description: Indicates if the prompt is shown on the rapids.

showPromptAsset.description: Whether the prompt asset should be shown on the rapids.

responseBudget.description: Total amount of responses that get collected per run

minResponses.description: The minimum amount of responses that need to be collected per comparison.

isInversed.description: If the results should be inversed, meaning people should select the worse model.

validationSetId.description: The Validation set that should be attached to every run.

audienceId.description:
Optional audience ID. When provided, the leaderboard will target users who have
 graduated from the audience (i.e., users with a score at or above the audience's minimum threshold).
 Cannot be specified together with Filters.

filters.description:
The filters will be applied on every order that is created by this leaderboard.
 Cannot be specified together with AudienceId.

featureFlags.description: Feature flags that will be applied to every order that is created by this leaderboard.

CreateLeaderboardModel.description: The CreateLeaderboardModel class represents the model for creating a leaderboard.

identifier.description: The identifier used to correlate samples of different participants.

asset.description: The asset input for the sample.

CreateSampleModel.description: The model used to create a sample to a participant.

identifier.description: An identifier associated to the prompt

tags.description: The tags of a given prompt

SubmitPromptModel.description: The model user for submitting a prompt to a benchmark.

name.description: The new name of the benchmark.

isPublic.description: Whether the benchmark should be public (only admins can change this).

UpdateBenchmarkModel.description: The model used to update a benchmark.

name.description: The new name of the benchmark.

UpdateBenchmarkNameModel.description: The model used to update the name of a benchmark.

name.description: The new name of the leaderboard.

responseBudget.description: The amount of responses that will be collected when onboarding a new participant.

minResponses.description: The amount of responses that will be collected as a minimum on each matchup.

UpdateLeaderboardModel.description: The model used to update a leaderboard.

name.description: The new name of the leaderboard.

UpdateLeaderboardNameModel.description: The model used to update the name of a leaderboard.

responseBudget.description: The amount of responses that will be collected when onboarding a new participant.

minResponses.description: The amount of responses that will be collected as a minimum on each matchup.

UpdateLeaderboardResponseConfigModel.description: The model used to update the name of a leaderboard.

name.description: The new name of the participant.

UpdateParticipantModel.description: The model used to update a participant.

name.description: The new name of the participant.

UpdateParticipantNameModel.description: The model used to update the name of a participant.

tags.description: The list of tags to be associated with the prompt.

UpdatePromptTagsModel.description: The model for updating prompt tags.

Bearer.description: JWT Authorization header using the Bearer scheme

OAuth2.description: OAuth2 authorization header using the Bearer scheme
